boardgame.name: Cloud Seeker
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Seek Your Absolution Above the Clouds.

SHOTGLASS ROUNDS are PDF-only One-Shots for 5e for the DM who doesn’t like to prep! Flexible, convenient, super-charged excitement in a compact package that won’t have you sitting up for hours doing prep for your next game session! Each adventure is designed for a 4-5 hour game and includes 2 new monsters, 2 new magic items, a full-size player’s map with grid & a full-size grid-less player’s map!!

boardgame.name: Tuned
boardgame.description:
In Tuned, you want to get your animal band in order so that they'll be ready to play — and although you're competing for space in the practice room with another band, you can incorporate all the musicians in your quest for the right arrangement.

To set up, each player takes two donkeys, two dogs, two cats, and one rooster. Place the rooster on the "move a figure" action space on your side of the 3x3 game board, leaving your two "add a figure" actions exposed.

On a turn, move your rooster to an open action space on your side of the board. If you choose "add", then place one of your figures on the board by following the placement rules:


Place a donkey only on an empty space.
Place a dog on an empty space or on an unencumbered donkey.
Place a cat on an empty space or on an unencumbered dog.


For a "move" action, choose an animal on the game board and move it to a new location while following the placement rules. You can move a portion of a stack; you cannot reverse the opponent's previous move.

As soon as a player creates an orthogonal or diagonal row with three of the same animals on top, that player wins. If a player is forced to add an animal (because their rooster occupies the lone "move" action) but cannot, they lose.

boardgame.name: Elefun Flyers
boardgame.description: A plastic elephant launches circular discs up into the air. Load the flyers into the elephant's trunk, and step down on its tail to launch them into the air. Players take turns launching discs and try to catch them in their nets. The person who gathers the most discs wins the game.

boardgame.name: Travelus: Evacuate
boardgame.description:
At the beginning, animals are peacefully roaming around their nine sanctuaries. Now, a disaster threatens to destroy eight of them. The animals have a limited time to evacuate before each sanctuary is destroyed. Destinarc is the only safe place and they must evacuate there to escape the danger and help save other animals - their own kind or all kinds.

You can play this game in two modes: competitive and co-operative. In competitive mode, players play for themselves and the winner is the player who saves the most animals of one type. In co-operative mode, everyone works together and wins when all animals are safely evacuated.

On your turn, you roll a die and move one of the animals the same number of spaces or to an unoccupied stone with the same number. Every two turns or so, a Warning card is pulled to show which board will disappear. You must move the animals off that board quickly before the board is removed along with everything on it. Be careful! The board you just landed on may go next! Or there may be no escape route left!

In those dire situations, there is always hope when the animals work together to save one another.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Travelus: Describe
boardgame.description:
As a travel journalist, you explore, study, and write about different places and cultures. You get to travel around the Continents and to describe the world with your own unique style. From covering travel destinations and accommodations to celebrations and festivals, your adventures always start and end with words.

Your goal is to score the highest points for a collection of words.

On your turn, you roll a die and move the same number of spaces to make your way to different destinations and collect letters from Source and Interview cards to form words. But your words don't count unless you submit them to an Editorial Office for publication and unused letters take points away.

Stories are everywhere and you are always on the go: Meeting a source at the park, networking at the hotel, sharing leads with a colleague, all while juggling other life commitments. Your assignments can be exciting and you are often left to your own devices to deal with challenges wherever you are.

Combining your ability to navigate unfamiliar places with your aptitude to express, will you be the most prolific Journalist?

boardgame.name: Travelus: Expose
boardgame.description:
You are the Head of the Intelligence Agency in your country and you send astute Spies around the globe to gather intel. Their missions are scattered throughout the Continents where rivals may be. They are required to get specific assets at certain locations. With the stakes at their absolute highest and time pressing on, Spies must decide their best move in every turn.

Spies aim to complete many missions within the time limit. The winner is the player who completes the most missions.

At the beginning of the game, you are given a deadline and Resource cards to get you moving towards your destinations as set out in your secret Mission card.

On your way, you collect and exchange Resource and Intel cards. Restrictions are in place and you risk being interrogated or exposed at every turn. Should you negotiate to form alliances to keep your Spies a bit safer, or should you take every chance you get to push the rivals away?

With constant shifting power and priority, can you achieve your missions in time?

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Travelus: Launch
boardgame.description:
You are the lead engineer of the space program in your territory whose mission is to be the leader in space technology. All territories are competing to build the next rocket that has the biggest launch mass to transport both people and large building materials to Mars.

A rocket requires 6 modules that must be placed in the correct sequence. You must acquire these modules from different territories within the interterritorial network and be the first to assemble your rocket to launch.

To build your rocket, you must acquire 6 unique Modules before your opponents. You must assemble the Modules in a particular order.

Starting with an isolated Territory, each turn you take one of the two actions: 1. Join or leave the interterritorial network or 2. Pick up a Speed card to help get you the Modules you need.

If you stay isolated, you won't be able to get anything from other Territories. But joining the network gives others access to everything of yours.

What and when will you do?

boardgame.name: Travelus: Top
boardgame.description:
A potentially hazardous asteroid is about to hit the planet. We have the laser to destroy the asteroid, but it must be shot from the peak of Destinarc which is not accessible by helicopter or plane.

A team of mountain climbers must reach Destinarc before time runs out. They must travel through treacherous and rough terrains separated by deep crevasses. Each climber is responsible for securing 1 ladder and leaving 1 supply pack behind to aid their survival on the way back.

All of your Climbers, each with a laser part, must reach Destinarc within a limited number of moves.

Every Climber starts with 8 attached playing pieces and ends with 4.

On each turn, after turning over a Trekking card and as the team leader, the active player consults with other players, decides which Climber is in the best position to move, to secure a ladder, or to leave the supplies, then acts accordingly.

You must work together to plan and apply your approaches and moves. It’s always farther, taller, and harder than it looks.

Can your team save the planet?

boardgame.name: Travelus: Shape
boardgame.description:
Many years ago an artist traveled the world and paid for her travels by creating a piece of art for everyone who helped her. It has been discovered that there are 64 pieces still exist somewhere on the planet. You, as one of many passionate art collectors, are on a treasure hunt to build your collection through competitive and relentless acquisition, bidding, and trading.

Your goal is to complete your collection of 8 Article cards of 1 shape or 8 unique shapes. Your collection also counts when you have 4 or more cards of 1 shape or different shapes. Each piece of art must have a Frame. The game ends when one player gets their collection appraised. The winner is the player whose collection has the highest value.

On your turn, you choose from 2 options that let you hunt art pieces from different sources. Acquiring, bidding, and trading are a key part of this highly competitive and intimidating process. You will need lots of money and maybe insurance too! Building your dream art collection is certainly possible but a difficult task that is not for the faint of heart.

Do you have what it takes?

boardgame.name: Lizzy Loves Darcy: A Jane Austen Matchmaking Game
boardgame.description:
To play the game, choose your character and spin the spinner. Depending on what square you land on, you will climb social ladders, slide down ropes of scandal, spin again or answer Jane Austen Trivia questions. To win the game, land on square 100, where a pair of golden rings announces that you have found your partner.

Contains reversible game board, rule booklet, spinner, 24 counters, and 100 trivia cards.

boardgame.name: Monster City: karty dodatkowe
boardgame.description: This promo pack for the polish version of Quietville, obtainable in the publisher's contests, adds three new cards and a new endgame scoring mechanic - number of buildings bonuses, to the main game. After each monster attack, the player chooses one of the cards and saves it in the ruins deck, face-down, rather than removing it from the game. At the end of the game, each person with the most cards of a certain colour (or the most value in case of a tie) in their ruins deck gains the appropriate bonus card, and 5 points at the end of the game.

boardgame.name: Ka-Blab!
boardgame.description:
Blurt it out before time runs out! The Ka-Blab! game is one of the fastest, frenzied, word games for adults and families that has players blurting out items or a catchphrase before time runs out

In each round, players take turns rolling the dice, game is to come up with that number of things that fit the topic listed on the card. They keep rolling and naming items until they can pass to the next player. The electronic timer is randomized so no one knows when it'll go off. If it goes off on a players' turn they lose a token. Lose all 3 tokens and you're out!

boardgame.name: Rolling Realms: Rolling Realms Promo Pack
boardgame.description: The second promo realm is inspired by the Rolling Realms game itself. It gives you the freedom to write any number on any of the 3 faces of the "worlds" on it, gaining your choice of a resource below that world. At the end of the round, you'll score 1 star per completed world whose faces each have a different number, as well as 1 star per complete world whos sum is equal to the sum of another world.

boardgame.name: Spirit Chasers
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Doskvol’s Spirit Wardens have a new thorn in their side: crews of hooligans beating them to recently dead bodies and absconding with them into the night. Their reasons are unknown—are they simple corpse robbers? Studying the moment of death? Or do they believe they’re saving the deceased’s ghost from annihilation in the acid chambers of Bellweather Crematorium? Whatever their reasons, they’re well organized, and they seem to have a plan...

Spirit Chasers is both a new crew type and a mechanical hack of Blades in the Dark about making death more personal in the city of Doskvol.

boardgame.name: Tell Me Without Telling Me
boardgame.description:
Introducing Tell Me Without Telling Me, the viral trend now an adult party game! Prepare for laughs as you try to get your team to guess the word on the card without breaking 1 of 3 rules:

Show Don’t Tell - no words allowed, let your body do the talking
One Syllable: only words with a single syllable. This would work, but this *wouldn’t* work
Freestyle: Any words are fair game, just not what’s on the card. Whether it's a Person, Place, Trait, Thing, or NSFW, you’ll have to think quick about how to "tell" your team before the time runs out! This game is for teens and adults ages 18 and up, and we advise playing with family and coworkers at your own risk. Grab your favorite people and play #TellMeGame ASAP.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Afghanistan '11: Royal Marines
boardgame.description:
Afghanistan ’11 is back with a new expansion and COIN strategy has never been this intense! Royal Marines brings back the winning formula of Afghanistan ’11 and innovates on it with plenty new features. A new campaign, a new faction, plenty new units, civilian vehicles, car bombs, roadblocks, Afghan police… Royal Marines is a must-have for all Afghanistan ’11 players.

UK CAMPAIGN

A new scenario campaign is included for the UK Army, following the deployment of the Royal Marines into Afghanistan. From Operation Ptarmigan to Operation Ghartse Dagger, the new campaign adds 10 new unique scenarios for dozens of hours of additional fun. Lead the British forces in their attempt to stabilize the region, with plenty new units such as the Warthog (capable of traversing mountains), the Scimitar or the Jackal.

CIVILIAN VEHICLES

Civilian vehicles will now randomly spawn on the Highway and the Roads connected to it and travel across it to other villages. But beware of…Car Bombs: Civilian vehicles might be carrying explosives which will detonate upon reaching their destination village. Build roadblocks to stop and search vehicles and you might be able to prevent a car bomb attack. Doing so will give you Hearts & Minds as well as give you Intel.

AFGHAN POLICE

Win enough H&M in a village and you will receive an Afghan Police unit, capable of taking part to Roadblocks as well as to gather Intel in villages without the need of infantry.

INTELLIGENCE FROM VILLAGES

The window of opportunity for gathering intelligence from villages now occurs randomly and only remains available for a random period of time after the fire first starts to burn. This represent the village elders having a meeting and then disbanding.

FOB CAPACITY

FOBs now have limited capacity to house troops and vehicles. Whenever a FOB is overcrowded, the player will incur PP costs for every unit over the limit.

AUTOMATIC TRIGGER OF ISAF HANDOVER

Whenever a player has an overall H&M score of above 70 for four (4) consecutive turns, the ISAF handover process is automatically triggered.

SPECIAL FORCES PROXIMITY COMBAT MODIFIER

Whenever regular infantry are within the spotting range of a SF unit, they will receive an additional combat bonus.

UNIFORM

A unique and separate uniform displaying new awards, badges and medals for the UK army has been added.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Kriegsmesser
boardgame.description:
Kriegsmesser is a tabletop RPG zine that was created for #zinequest 2021. It was inspired by history (cca. 1453-1630) and roleplaying games named after medieval weapons.

It's focus are 36 backgrounds compatible with Troika by Melsonian Arts Council, but it comes with a set of custom rules and can be played standalone.

Also includes some essays, GM tools, random tables, rules for horrible injuries, recommended media and a bunch of historical woodcut art.

What is it not?


It's not a historical game as such, it's fairly anachronistic and sparse on detail.



It is not high fantasy with evil gods and orcs and wizards and pirate elves on lizard mounts.


(Publisher Blurb)

boardgame.name: Rum & Rollmops
boardgame.description:
A card-based strategy game for 2-6 players that does not require dice or a game board. The object of the game is to amass the most valuable collection of goods. These are stored in 12 Hanseatic cities and must be transported by ships to the home port. But be careful - the journey across the Baltic Sea is fraught with danger! In a Baltic tussle on the high seas, you quickly lose your cog and goods. Then fast forged alliances can help or the next ship sent on the journey is a highly equipped privateer.

The goal of the game is to transport the most valuable collection of goods from foreign ports to your home port.
The game ends when the first player has no ship left.

—description from the publisher

Ziel des Spieles ist es, die wertvollste Sammlung von Gütern anzuhäufen. Diese sind in 12 Hansestädten gelagert und müssen mit Schiffen in den Heimathafen transportiert werden. Aber Vorsicht: Die Fahrt über die Ostsee birgt Gefahren! Bei einer baltischen Balgerei auf hoher See ist man schnell Kogge und Güter los. Dann können schnellgeschmiedete Allianzen helfen oder das nächste Schiff, was auf die Reise geschickt wird, ist ein hochgerüsteter Freibeuter.
Spielziel ist es, die wertvollste Sammlung von Gütern aus fremden Häfen in seinen Heimathafen zu transportieren.
Das Spiel ist beendet, wenn der erste Spieler kein Schiff mehr besitzt.

—description from the publisher (German)

boardgame.name: Sensō: Battle For Japan
boardgame.description:
Historically grounded, Sensō is a light wargame featuring area-control mechanics and a light, trick-taking card mechanic.

Sensō, Wage war to become the Emperor through the trampling of your enemies.

Sensō is a 2 to 5 player light trick taking / area control war game set within the early stages of the Sengoku period. The Year is 1570, Oda has grown to be one of the strongest clans in the civil war period, taking control of central Japan. Drawing the attention of neighbouring clans Takeda, Uesugi and Mori

Sensō contains a standard deck of 54 playing cards designed by Raben White and inspired by Japanese wood carvings of the daimyos and heroes of the Sengoku period. 32 coloured wooden cubes, matching the 4 playable clans. Clan cards for each player with their clan symbol and the 5th player as the Emperor. 4 illustrated cards creating the Map of Japan showing the provinces and territories to control and score Victory Points.

Players control 1 of the 4 main clans, Oda, Takeda, Uesugi and Mori and for a 5 player game, controlling the Emperor of Japan. Each round players are dealt cards with each Clan earning favour and becoming Trump Suit. At the end of each round the tricks / hands won by each player are counted and used to move, add their own clan cubes and/or remove others to gain dominance in the 10 territories of central Japan. After 8 rounds victory points are awarded based on who has control over each area of the map. They are totalled with the player with the highest score declared the winner.

boardgame.name: Agatha Christie - Hercule Poirot: The First Cases
boardgame.description:
In his early years as a detective, Hercule Poirot is invited to a reception by the influential Van den Bosch family, for the announcement of their daughter’s engagement. But tensions amongst the guests run high as a snowstorm descends on the town, trapping everyone inside the manor. The happy event is soon marred by the murder of one of the guests…

In the right place at the right time, Poirot immediately begins to investigate. What buried secrets and deadly rivalries will he uncover?

Rediscover the legendary detective in an all-new crime story.
Play as Hercule Poirot in his early years as a detective, when he still had everything to prove.
Solve a complex murder case where everyone has something to hide.
Unveil what hides behind the deceiving appearances of the Van den Bosch family.
Question all the suspects and glean crucial information from them without their knowing.
Notice all suspicious behavior as you uncover the dark secrets and rivalries of the upper class.
Explore a luxurious house full of buried mysteries. There is more to discover than just the murderer…
Use your talents of deduction to link clues in your mindmap.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: TOEM
boardgame.description:
set off on a delightful expedition and use your photographic eye to uncover the mysteries of the magical TOEM

follow a small figure through scandinavian inspired landscapes

encounter several characters and distinct architectural environments

take photos, listen to calm music and travel by bus!
climb the highest peak and experience the phenomenon TOEM.

a game which encourages you to "stop and smell the flowers"

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Frog Detective 3: Corruption at Cowboy County
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





In the exciting series finale, The Detective and Lobster Cop are tasked to solve the conundrum of a sheriff-less county. But not all is as it seems here, when a surprisingly simple solution to the case reveals a sinister scheme. Maybe crime is real after all...Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Dice Hospital
boardgame.description: App version of the board game Dice Hospital.

boardgame.name: They Came From The Bermuda Triangle!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are few places on this wide world quite so mysterious, quite so confusing, quite so terrifying, as the Bermuda Triangle. This is what makes it a perfect spot for battles, explorations, and high seas hijinks in They Came from Beneath the Sea!

They Came from the Bermuda Triangle! includes:

Simple combat rules for maritime battles betwixt trawler, canoe, submarine, cruiser liner, and more!
New aquatic alien threats native to the Bermuda Triangle!
Multiple stories set in the Bermuda Triangle, ready to be run for your group!
Rules for vehicles in They Came from Beneath the Sea!
boardgame.rpg: They Came From Beneath the Sea!

boardgame.name: Template: Mole Mech
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mole Mechs are tiny robots, often termed nanobots, that are implanted inside a human or animal body. From the point of implantation, the Mole Mech can undertake any number of amazing and sometimes terrifying effects. Sometimes the nanobots simply bond to the host’s organs, making them stronger, faster or smarter. Other times, the Mole Mech’s nanobots make up a series of disassembled components that, when activated, manifest as astonishing external machinery. Generally speaking, the robots that make up a Mole Mech are hundreds of thousands in quantity, each no more than one micron squared in size. Due to their tiny size, the nanobots that make up a Mole Mech, when manifested, often are seen as a mass whose knitting is so small and tight they appear to be a single, solid, object.

boardgame.name: European Union Guardians
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The European Union has their own Guardians, but are they helping? What are heroes to do when politics gets in the way of deployment? It's an everyday struggle for these Guardians.

This module is in full color.

Includes:

-Stats for EU Guardians and their handler.

-Headquarter info.

boardgame.name: Monsters Twilight 12
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's 12 years of G-Core, so it's time once again for the yearly Monsters Twilight!

Get some Taint, Kung-Fu and a rat!

boardgame.name: Sewer Rat
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Players are hired for an easy recovery job. Simples, except it may get a bit damp.

Set in the city of Cadanbyrig in the Kingdom of Urtind, from the Dragon Reaches of Marakush.

boardgame.name: The Book of Doom
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The players expecting some R&R in Cadanbyrig arrive at the village of Baldwell on route and find the Charging Boar Inn to spend the night.

All is well until the Hue and Cry is raised.

Set to the south of the city of Cadanbyrig in the Kingdom of Urtind, from the Dragon Reaches of Marakush.

boardgame.name: Lurker in the Night
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Players while travelling through the deep winter snow seek shelter and happen upon a village seemingly deserted.

Ideal as an introductory adventure for Chivalry & Sorcery 5th edition, or can be dropped into any campaign as a side trek.

boardgame.name: Harpy Song
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Discover what strange fate has befell a caravan on the road.

A side trek that can be dropped into any campaign or used as an introductory adventure.

boardgame.name: Age of Steel: Better Backgrounds
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Backgrounds in Age of Steel represent financial, material, or personal assets available to a character that may prove useful in their adventures.

This free supplement updates the rules for four of the backgrounds found in the Age of Steel core rulebook and also adds an additional five new backgrounds for players to choose from for their characters.

boardgame.name: Fighter Archtype: Triggerman
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Introducing the first of many extras for Memento Mori. This is the Triggerman, a special Archetype designed for the Fighter class specializing in pistols.

boardgame.name: Occultist Dark Tradition: Fleshweaver
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new class option for the Occultist class of Memento Mori. The Fleshweaver is an occultist that learns to specialize in controlling the flesh of living creatures and resisting harm. You will need the Occultist class to make use of this, however, it can be EASILY adapted for the Wizard class.

boardgame.name: The Dollmaker
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A horror themed adventure module for a party of 4th level adventurers.

Within the small city of Somerton, inside the Kingdom of Alleagne, the peasantry cries out against a string of grave robberies going ignored. When a noble’s daughter is removed from her resting place just moments after her burial, a bounty is sent out demanding the heads of these ne’er do wells. It falls to you to investigate this matter and stop this series of crimes once and for all.

This Adventure Module brings you face to face with the harrowing events occuring inside of Somerton and its surrounding graveyards. You will face terrifying challenges and frightening creatures. This module can be used alongside any setting or as a complement to the Memento Mori: Ars Technica & Memento Mori: Vaetia books

boardgame.name: Bien Cordialement
boardgame.description:
Bien Cordialement is a humorous ambiance game. The goal is to turn a classical painting into a meme-like cartoon by combining nonsensical sentences with the images.
A game master votes on the most funny creation and determines the winner
