boardgame.name: The Oracle (Issue 16 - Nov 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Oracle Issue 16 - Spooky Theme
Just as all characters are better equipped when they have a bag of holding, a potion of healing and a sunrod, a GM is better equipped when supplied with a steady stream of new material and ideas.

And that's what we have for you here.

This month we bring you, in one fully illustrated PDF the following system-neutral Fantasy RPG material:

Contents

Game Advice - Making it Spooky and Show, Don't Tell a Scene
Bag of Rats - 12 Tips for using Rats in Game
7 Uses for Dead Characters - the players might hate you, be warned!
3 Creepy locations including a library that records all sins
Blessed Be His Fur - Meet Rattacus, the Rat God
6 Detailed NPCs including a a ghost, a sorceress, a vengeful warrior, a demon and a vampire
Fun With Bones - how to use skeletons in game
Player Anecdote that shows how a great DM hands a situation
Hal and Roger - Back and talking about three of the strangest creatures they have encountered so far
Safety Card - how to keep players safe, literally
Picture Prompt - designed to get you thinking creatively
Disease Control - how to catch lycanthropy and more
8 Creepy Adventure hooks
4 Truly Uncanny and Different Encounters
10 Trinkets and treasure
Your Hexed - 14 hexes to cast on the player characters!
Final Word - a Rat Lord would like a word with you

boardgame.name: The Oracle (Issue 17 - Nov 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Oracle Issue 17 - Opposites Theme
(Think cults vs religious orders, saints vs sinners, large creatures vs small ones etc...)

Just as all characters are better equipped when they have a bag of holding, a potion of healing and a sunrod, a GM is better equipped when supplied with a steady stream of new material and ideas.

And that's what we have for you here.

This month we bring you, in one fully illustrated PDF the following system-neutral Fantasy RPG material:

Contents

Game Advice - Avoiding binary thinking and why yin and yang can really help
10 Orders and 10 Cults briefly introduced along with a random table to generate their HQ name
6 Detailed NPCs including a living construct, a knight, a cavalier, a ronin, an assassin and a priest
34 Adventure hooks that relate to Orders and Cults
Hal and Roger - Talking about five of the larger and smaller creatures that they have encountered
2 Cool locations including a 'living-forest' - not like you expect!
2 magic Items, both with 2 different powers
Extreme Characters - how to use them to set a scene and necromancers, vampires, demons zealots and even snobs discussed
8 Encounters with opposing individuals
10 Trinkets and treasure
Vengence is mine saith the Lord - a short article on waring angels including 8 story hooks
Picture Prompt - to get you thinking creatively

boardgame.name: The Oracle (Issue 18 - Dec 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Oracle Issue 18 - Mischief And Merriment Theme
(Think gift giving, people pretending to be good but not being up to any good, winter solstice event, magic etc...)

Just as all characters are better equipped when they have a bag of holding, a potion of healing and a sunrod, a GM is better equipped when supplied with a steady stream of new material and ideas.

And that's what we have for you here.

This month we bring you, in one fully illustrated PDF the following system-neutral Fantasy RPG material:

Contents

Game Advice - How to give gifts to gamers in-game to reinforce character grown and the setting (and just for the fun of giving!)
36 magic item gift ideas including tattoos, potions, ornaments, necklaces, scrolls and even invitations
10 Orders and 10 Cults briefly introduced along with a random table to generate their HQ name
1 Detailed organisaion - Lords of Misrule
1 Location - City of Lutece
10 Story Hooks
Four new creatures to terrify and amaze your players with
Meet an avatar of winter herself - the Winter Solstice Queen
Winter Migrations - how to use winter to move your game world around and mix things up
4 Winter Incursions - how winter can extent into your world in magical and unsettling ways including storms, frozen rooms, and frozen places to hide treasure
12 Trinkets and treasures for characters to find
Meet the King of Fools - a paper position of royalty that could be subverted by the right NPC
2 detailed winter NPCs including a sorceress and a werebear guardian
Answers from readers to another readers creative challenges
Seasonal Fun - 3 mini word games to relax with
Picture Prompt - designed to get you thinking creatively
Readers gift - good until the end of Jan 2022 this is for EVERY reader
Ahoy 2022 - a look ahead at some of the things coming up in 2022 that might be worth parting with a bag of gold for

boardgame.name: Circle of the Worldsoul
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new Druid sub-class for 5E that lets you become a manifestation of the land. It is a very versatile spell casting subclass that gives you access to different spells and abilities depending on the terrain you are in.

This subclass contains 16 new spells, some of which appear in other products by The Realm Scribe, 9 of which that are totally new.

boardgame.name: Yuncos: El lado oscuro de la luz
boardgame.description:
On the island of Choros, located in Chile, in the Coquimbo region, there is a small bird from the group of petrels, called Yunco. This bird of nocturnal and oceanic habits uses the moon and the stars to guide its flight and, therefore, is seriously affected by light pollution from cities, which causes shocks as a result of disorientation.
In this game you will roll dice, you will take one to select the best route to help the Yunco in its flight, to get food and avoid hitting an obstacle, as well as to be able to return to the island and nest. The other die, you will use to complete puzzles of nests and luminaire improvement.

—description from the designer

En la isla de Choros, ubicada en Chile, en la región de Coquimbo, habita una pequeña ave del grupo de los petreles, llamada Yunco. Esta ave de hábitos nocturnos y oceánicos, utiliza la luna y las estrellas para orientar su vuelo y, por lo tanto, se ve gravemente afectada por la contaminación lumínica de las ciudades, lo que provoca choques producto de la desorientación.
En este juego ayudarás al Yunco en su vuelo para conseguir comida y evitar chocar con algún obstáculo, para poder volver a la isla y anidar.

—description from the designer (Spanish)

boardgame.name: Heroes of Filbar
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Heroes of Filbar is a collection of characters designed to be used in a pinch or as NPCs when you are short on time. With eight different characters per level and equipment you can construct henchmen, hirelings, or PCs for one shot adventures on the fly! This supplement comes with reference points for each of the classes represented and even a table to add "special" items to the character. Don't get caught flatfooted again keep this reference handy for random encounters in taverns, dungeons, or the adventurer's guild!

This adventure supplement was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for an initial party spanning all the way to 9th level!

boardgame.name: RPG Writer's Primer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

As we celebrate our 7th year as a publisher, we thought we'd offer this guide on how we got to where we are. A lot of you have asked up for tips and advice, here you go, all in one place. Thanks for finding us over the years and we've still got plenty of titles headed your way!

boardgame.name: "The Pistris"
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

As we sail into 2022, we thought you may need a vessel for your new adventure. For that, we present "The Pistris" a Tortle warship! In Margou, the players 'acquired' it and utilized it. What will your players use it for?

boardgame.name: Druid Circle: Circle of Permafrost
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With the belief that the Circle of Permafrost housed wisdom lost to the ages, some more academically-inclined druids have attempted to recreate the ancient practice, emphasizing a sense of animism and embracing its unique ceramic craftsmanship, which often resembles coils or knots of extruded clay reinforcing traditionally-spun pieces. These druids augment and arm themselves with earthen shells and call upon animating spirits to create Dogu companions capable of absorbing their allies’ ailments.

Building off of the existing Fifth Edition rules to build a druid character, the Circle of Permafrost wields animistic magic to bring Dogu effigies to life to cure their allies' ailments and heal them.

boardgame.name: Cohetes
boardgame.description:
Rockets is a card game where the goal is to build a rocket and be the astronaut who goes the furthest on his space journey. The more basic operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication and division) you perform, the more fuel you will receive.

It is a game that, at the same time as a useful resource to consolidate basic procedures for solving (mathematical) problems, we learn facts about history, numbers, planets and various curiosities!

With several alternative game modes for different ages, difficulty and number of players.



Cohetes es un juego de cartas donde el objetivo es construir un cohete y ser el astronauta que más lejos llegue en su viaje espacial. Cuantas más operaciones básicas (suma, resta, multiplicación ydivisión) realices, más combustible recibirás.Es un juego que a la vez de un recurso útil para consolidar procedimientos básicos para la resolución de problemas (matemáticos), aprendemos datos de historia, de números, de planetas yde curiosidades varias!

Con varios modos de juego alternativos para diferentes edades, dificultad y número de jugadores.

(from the publisher)
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

boardgame.name: Shui Hu, the Water Tiger
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In honor of the Lunar New Year, we have released the Shui Hu! This publication includes a detailed D&D 5E description and stats for the “Water Tiger” of the Asian Zodiac and is a perfect addition to anything from a traditional fantasy campaign setting to one with East Asian or Wuxia elements.

Water Tigers, are large, dangerous Elemental monstrosities that have the heads, forequarters, and torsos of Tigers and the lower bodies of great Carps. Overall, they have a striking, frightening, and impressive appearance.

Water Tigers are very rare on the Prime Material Plane and those present on it will likely be found in freshwater ponds, marshes, and slow-moving streams and rivers in woodland areas. Water Tigers are sometimes also kept as guardians or companions by powerful spellcasters or water-dwelling Elemental beings like Marids. They can also be found in the temples of various deities, especially those associated with the Asian Zodiac or the element of water.

In cultures that observe the Lunar New Year and adhere to the Asian Zodiac, spellcasters sometimes summon Water Tigers to take part in annual celebrations. Such creatures are then typically displayed in ceremonial ponds, doted on and fed treats, and otherwise honored for the duration of their stays. They might also be summoned for things like assassinating enemies, defending temple sanctuaries from intruders, or anything else for which an aquatic predator would be ideal.

boardgame.name: TAVERN: Between-Game Events for OSR Players
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tavern: Between-Game Events for OSR Players, is a player-focused, resource book (zine-format, 5.5" wide x 8.5" tall, 24 pages) for OSR games. Tavern provides players (and their GM) with a workbook that offers their PCs a chance to become tavern owners. Through a series of workbook pages, players will roll randomly (with their GM) to discover what taverns are available for sale as well as the taverns' conditions (from leaning hovel to a new two-story marvel), reputations, trophies and awards, secret features, entertainers, and more. Oh, and profits, of course!

While the PCs are dungeon delving, a purchased tavern can be earning them coin that can fund future expeditions, buy new equipment, or even purchase tavern expansions and upgrades. (Or rebuild if an unfortunate event should ever occur.)

Once a tavern is selected and purchased, players can work with the GM to see what surprises that ownership brings each month. (A new Tavern 2-page spread will also appear in each future issue of Delver magazine so players can keep discovering the fun of tavern-ownership!)

boardgame.name: Delver (Issue #3 - Dec 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Delver Magazine is a bi-monthly (6 issues per year) resource for GMs of Old School RPG fantasy games such as Old-School Essentials, Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game, and other OSR games. Each issue will include a ready-to-play adventure, printable props, random charts & tables, articles, and maps for the included adventure.

boardgame.name: Invocación Fronteras: El Encuentro
boardgame.description:
1 vs 1 mode expansion for Invocación Fronteras.

Includes 2 promo cards:

Akari (41 - Air): Match your Reserve Mana to the player with the lowest Reserve Mana (minimum 1).
Azael (60 - Air/Earth/Water/Fire): Your Power is equal to the lowest Power at this time, multiplied by 3.



Medium difficulty for new and old summoners.

In this game mode the summoners prepare a deck each. Then they fight normally but the cards they use are the ones they set aside for themselves. It is a practical way to learn the cards and they generate a dynamic reminiscent of TCG or CCG games.

Although 1 vs 1 is recommended, it is just as functional for more players.

boardgame.name: Academy: The West Point Board Game
boardgame.description:
Academy is a family-friendly worker placement game with four rounds, each representing a year at West Point. During the game, players place their “Cadets” around the West Point campus to conduct training and face off in competitions. The goal is to become the Valedictorian by scoring the most points in the three pillars of the Academy (Academic, Military, Physical).

Just like at the real West Point, players must carefully manage their Competitions (e.g., IOCT or Term End Exams) with their Training (e.g., studying or doing duties). Drawing Training cards doesn’t score points, but players need Training cards to win Competitions. Remember that the most successful cadets play their cards well to graduate at the top of their class!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: MIAU!
boardgame.description:
In this game, the participants become cats, and they must take the other cats' objects. Don't forget to yell MEOW! and point to the other cat. Add 5 identical or different pictures and become the fastest cat in the game. For boys and girls from 5 years old.

Game tiles are divided equally among players and stacked upside down in front of them. All players turn over a tile at the same time and look for matching results. A player who spots a match with their tile must be the first to point and say "Miao!" to collect the matching tile.

The first player to get 5 sets, wins.


En este juego los participantes se convierten en gatos, y deben llevarse los objetos de los otros gatos. No te olvides de gritar MIAU! y señalar al otro gato. Sumá 5 dibujos iguales o diferentes y convertite en el gato más veloz del juego. Para chicos y chicas a partir de los 5 años.

boardgame.name: Hangok a fejemben
Voces en mi Cabeza
Voices In My Head
boardgame.description:
In Voices In My Head, players step into the courtroom and into the mind of a man on trial for robbing a bank. One player takes on the role of the prosecutor who is trying to convict the defendant, Guy, and send him to prison; everyone else takes on aspects of Guy's personality, such as Honesty or Selfishness, and attempts to influence the trial. To win the game, each player must achieve their hidden goal.

Each round, the prosecutor plays a trial card to present evidence, call witnesses, or grill Guy on the stand. Players then try to control Guy's actions by deploying control markers to a three-dimensional game board representing his brain. These actions will sway the jury in different ways and ultimately determine whether Guy goes free or is sent to prison.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Title: Voices In My Head Publisher: Unexpected Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: The Curious Case of Spaceship Kontula
boardgame.description: This science horror scenario was written in January 3rd 2022 as a part of RPGGeeks 24 hour dungeon contest. It is a system agnostic adventure, suitable for any science fiction universe where lovecratian monsters exist.

boardgame.name: The Voting Game: After Dark Edition
boardgame.description:
The Voting Game After Dark Edition is a group card game that uncovers the sometimes disturbing, sometime risqué, but always hilarious truths behind your friendships.

Play again and again—gameplay varies dramatically based on the friends you play with.

Get to know one another—personal stories are often shared after a revealing vote.

boardgame.name: Aetherya
boardgame.description:
In Aetherya, unexplored wilderness and a constantly changing kingdom await you. Humans, elves, dwarves, goblins and dragons live here, but don't always get along. Will you make history, or will your kingdom perish in conflict? It is up to you to shape the land according to your ideas and to accommodate all the inhabitants of Aetherya peacefully. But make sure that your neighboring kingdoms don't develop faster than you...

In the game, each player starts with a 4x4 face-down arrangement of cards, and each turn you draw a card to replace something in your playing space.

Aetherya includes three game modes — competitive, co-operative, and solo — as well as variants for players of different ability levels.

boardgame.name: The Lost Road
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the Lost Road. You become lost in all in things. In your life. Sense of self. And more. One day you lost your way and became truly Lost. Finding a Door, you escaped the labirynth you found yourself in. Now you are on the Road, a strange realm connected to all worlds.

boardgame.name: After the Fall
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Days after their escape from The Sanctuary, the survivors stop in the small rural town of Endroit to scavenge for supplies.

After the Fall is the third episode in The Living Dead Campaign. This non-traditional Savage Worlds Plot Point Campaign for Dead End takes your Novice survivor characters through the first year of the zombie apocalypse with a recurring series of monthly episodes that tell the gripping tale of fear and survival in a world claimed by the dead.

boardgame.name: Shots in the Dark
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“The job is simple: in two nights, a shipment of arms bound for the local NIEC garrison will be arriving in town. We want you to relieve them of it.”

So begins a shadowy job of deception and violence, as the heroes discover to what lengths the brutal minions of the National Interagency Enforcement Command will go to restore order in a tumultuous city. But like any other job, there’s more going on than meets the eye. Why all the secrecy? What are the nickys really up to? And how do the heroes tell friend from foe? The answers to those questions just might get them deleted.

Shots in the Dark is a short cyberpunk adventure for New World: 2D6 Adventure in a Cyberpunk America using the Cepheus Engine, Cepheus Deluxe and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG) rules.
boardgame.rpgsetting: New World: 2D6 Adventure in a Cyberpunk America

boardgame.name: Inbound
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

While the heroes’ ship is headed for the system’s mainworld, outsystem Traffic Control invokes astrotime law and sends them to investigate another inward ship that refuses to acknowledge hails. The reason for the silence pits the team against sinister forces that are determined to profit off human misery…but who are willing to destroy everything if they can’t.

Inbound is a short science fiction adventure using the Cepheus Engine, Cepheus Deluxe and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game rules. Other 2D6 systems are easily adapted.

boardgame.name: 5E Quest: Mastherik Manor
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Can You Solve the Mystery of Mastherik Manor?

A mysterious mansion has sprung up on the border between two kingdoms, Calximus and Drakungheist. The mansion is on the site of a dwarven mining colony that disappeared years ago in an avalanche. Two opposing magic schools sent by the kingdoms, Venefigrex and Zaubereich, have hired the PCs to track down the necromantic secrets it holds. But the mansion does not give up its secrets easily, and it will take clever PCs with an eye for detail and all their puzzle-solving skills to unravel the mystery of Mastherik Manor!

Inspired by escape rooms and amusement park rides, this adventure for 4th to 6th level characters features 200 tokens, 100 handouts, 70 battlemaps, 35 new monsters, 16 new spells, 12 new magic items, and a new arcane tradition (Biomancy).

boardgame.name: Above and Beyond
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A NEON BLOOD Expansion for Cyberpunk Action Among the Stars

You think the big shots are content to exploit the Earth? You think they are happy to control such a limited area and resources? Born yesterday I see. Above and Beyond takes your Glitches into orbit or the bounds of the solar system. Ever run a heist in space? Good luck.

A SHATTERED FAMILY

In the heydays of late 2029 and through today, the MegaCorps and the Nations of the Earth made earnest moves to expand into the region known as Sol Core for gathering rare elements and taking strategic positioning over their great power competitors. There was no possible way anyone in control could envision that, by mid-2035, there would exist a cold civil war occurring between the ground-based home offices of the powers that be and their once loyal orbital assets.

THE CHERYK DRIVE

After numerous experiments, conferences, movies, books, and colliders, humanity dipped back to an older idea and used what they now understood via modern scientific principals. The Nieves Croytonics and Dinova Aerospace, backed by DynaSoft and eGen, after several fatal disasters, options losses, sabotage, and worse, finally perfected the Cheryk Drive, completing the first successful run from the high orbit station to Luna and back in just over 5 hours; a new age dawned that cold day, 28 November 2032.

boardgame.name: Cartography of Eana
boardgame.description:
Description from the back of the book:

From the urban depths of the the free city to the frozen steppes of the Septentrion.

This supplement for Fateforge features detailed maps of territories and cities in the regions of the Free City, the Drakenbergen, the Septentrion, and the Kaan. It can be used by game masters as well as players. Contents include:


Maps of territories. Maps of the four great regions of Eana: the Free City and its outskirts, the Drakenbergen, the Septentrion, and the Kaan. Each map is 11,7 × 16,5 in (29,7 × 42 cm), fully colored.
Maps of cities. Fifteen maps present the great cities of these regions, showing important locations and landmarks. Each map is 11,7 × 16,5 in (29,7 × 42 cm), fully colored. You will discover among them the Free City, a cosmopolitan metropolis where many adventures begin; Dörharo's Lock, bastion of the guardian dwarves under the Drakenbergen, standing at the gates of the Netherworld; Easafir; the lavish and mysterious capital of Kartaçöl; and the cursed ruins of Mangulik, the ancient capital of Tamerakh the Conqueror. Each map also features the emblem of the city.
Map folder: The maps are gathered in a dedicated folder.

boardgame.name: Fateforge - Epic Tales in the World of Eana: Conditions
boardgame.description:
Description from the back of the box:

This deck includes 51 cards presenting all conditions and tactical situations featured in Fateforge. Each card is 2.75 × 4.75 in (7 × 12 cm).

boardgame.name: No Tears Over Spilled Coffee
boardgame.description:
From dndbeyond.com:

In "No Tears Over Spilled Coffee," the players' characters are new hires at Strixhaven University's famed Firejolt Café. When their manager suddenly grows ill, it's up to the party to keep the business running! This free D&D adventure is intended for a group of three to four 1st-level characters. It can be completed in about two to three hours and includes a free map from Strixhaven: A Curriculum of Chaos!

boardgame.name: The Pale Theologian: Lord of Life and Death
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Channel the forces of the Pale; life and death together as one!

The Pale Theologian: Lord of Life and Death is the latest class published by Studio M— for Pathfinder 1e! The Pale Theologian draws its power from the Pale, the source of both life and death. These spellcasters draw this energy into their own body, granting them aspects of both living and undead creatures and allowing them to utilize the effects of both positive and negative energy through necromancy.

These full-casters combine both arcane and divine necromancy spells, as well as gaining the ability to cast numerous spells as necromantic variants. Able to specialize as either arcane or divine spellcasters, these theurges draw from both the Wizard and Cleric spell lists. However, their specialization in necromantic magics limits their other schools significantly.

Utilizing their secrets of the pale the Pale Theologian can customize their magical talents to suit their needs; improving their ability to create undead, fortifying their bodies with necromancy, fortifying the strenght of their soul, or empowering their healing.

The Pale Theoloigian also supports a number of popular 3rd party subsystems, featuring archetypes for Akashic Magic, Psionics, Path of War, Spheres of Power, and Champions of the Spheres!

boardgame.name: Sniper: One shot
boardgame.description:
Sniper is a one player PnP game where you take control of one of the famous snipers in World War 2.
You take your sniper through different terrains and missions to try and achieve the stars for each one. The sniper's main aims are to stay hidden, survive, but to take out as many enemies as possible in the process.
Each turn consists of choices between hiding, moving or shooting. You will want to try and get close to the enemy lines top have the best chance of killing the officers and get the most points possible.
But in turn, you must also take care not to be seen! Even a successful shot can spell danger for you if this has been seen by a fellow enemy as they will return fire!
Complete the objectives given in your mission and stay alive.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Big Book of NPCs: Allies & Antagonists
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Big Book of NPCs for Dungeons & Dragons 5e
Allies & Antagonists: A Big Book of NPCs is your complete resource for breathing life into your non-player characters. No longer will your players need to converse with a simple guard or commoner. The NPCs detailed in this book give Game Masters unique art, lore, and game stats; you’ll be sure to find something suitable to help craft memorable adventures at your table!

Allies & Antagonists contains the following:
NON-PLAYER CHARACTERS – Introduce your players to over 100 new NPCs, each with unique art, lore, and game stats.
MAGIC ITEMS – Some of the NPCs in this book wield power magic items. Maybe they will offer one as a reward?

boardgame.name: Rocket Rescue
boardgame.description:
The world is a desolate wasteland and you try to evacuate your crew before it is too late. You research rocket technology, build modules and sell them to space companys that fly your crew to far away places. But do the rockets have enough fuel and shielding for this dangerour journey? Whoever manages to rescue their crew first is the winner of this race to outer space.

A fun strategy game with secret action selection, resource management, cards and dice.
In each phase the player with the highest die/dice goes first and the higher the die the better the abilities. But be careful, as the higher the dice the more energy you have to spend. Draft rocket technologies and build them with resources from a market where the availability of the goods depends on the demand. Build rockets by yourself or together and be the first to board them with your crew. Launch the rockets and aim for different planets with various hazards and rewards.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: めるかるた (Meru Karuta)
boardgame.description:
めるかるた (Meru Karuta) is a Karuta game from Japan. Karuta is a classic card game in which one person reads a line on a card from a classic poem, and the other two players must snatch or guard the open card that has the successive couplet.

In this game, Meru Karuta, the cards have tricky Kanji, the Japanese characters that derive from Chinese. Kanji are often hard for experienced Japanese readers, and the game plays on that problem.

Each Kanji in the game is some version of a word with '-meru'. So players only have to get to something-meru in order to identify the card in question. However, the kanji are so tricky, and the game gives no assistance to help the readers, so there is no expectation for anybody to read it correctly, not the reader nor the players. Everybody is just meant to make the best they can and hack through it without worrying too much about accuracy.
user summary

boardgame.name: Old London Bridge
boardgame.description:
It's London in 1136, and the great wooden bridge across the mighty Thames has been consumed by fire. Soon the churchman Peter de Colechurch plans to construct a new, fortified bridge from stone upon which various buildings may be built over the years. Players are architects who are each responsible for one section of the (new) "Old London Bridge."

By playing character cards, you will contribute to the construction of the game's 3D bridge. Buildings must be built with house numbers in. Each house has a coat of arms that will grant special abilities, new character cards, and increase the player's income. The architect at the end of the game who has the most money is the winner.

Old London Bridge is light-medium complexity game by designers Gabriele Bubola and Leo Colovini that plays in under an hour and features:


A 3D cardboard bridge for increased atmosphere.
A special bidding and building mechanism
Variable victory conditions


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Win The Night
boardgame.description:
Win The Night allows you to live out the glorious debauchery of nightlife without having to change out of your sweat pants or get off the couch.

Grab up to eight of your friends for a metaphorical race home from a wild night out. One by one you'll take turns rolling the die and letting the cards choose your fate. You might stumble into a dance battle or have to recall a forgotten memory. Either way, all bets are off and only one player will Win The Night.

boardgame.name: The Hundred Acres
boardgame.description:
Basically, a classic Winnie-the-Pooh style tabletop roleplaying game using Caltrop Core system created by TitanomachyRPG for Caltrop jam.

https://jedimazzie.itch.io/the-hundred-acres

boardgame.name: Space Samurais
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a Honey Heist hack for players to become Force users and deal with light side vs dark side inner conflicts.

boardgame.name: Gili's Guide to Fantastical Plants
boardgame.description:
From the publisher: Gili's Guide to Fantastical Plants is a fantasy RPG zine to help you bring a fresh mix of fun, useful, and dangerous plants to your imaginary worlds! Whether you are a Table-Top RPG Game Master looking to make the landscape come alive, a player wanting more ways for your character to engage with the natural world, or just someone who likes thinking about weird fantasy stuff, Gili's Guide has got what you need!

The project was originally on Kickstarter, but is also available from the publisher.

boardgame.name: Gamer's Handbook of the Transformers - Generation One Decepticons: Series 1
boardgame.description:
User Summary:

Book about the 1st Generation Decepticons, presented in the MSH RPG Gamer's Handbook of the Marvel Universe style, with Decepticons from Acidstorm through Thundercracker

boardgame.name: Gamer's Handbook of the Transformers - Generation One Autobots: Series 1
boardgame.description:
User Summary:

Book about the 1st Generation Autobots, presented in the MSH RPG Gamer's Handbook of the Marvel Universe style, with the Autobots from Bluestreak through Windcharger.

boardgame.name: United in Purpose
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:
When a group of Pathfinder Society initiates recently completed their Confirmation and rescued a fellow Pathfinder, they also uncovered a host of ruins belonging to an ancient civilization. Now, the Society’s major factions have sent their foremost experts and leaders to begin coordinating a thorough investigation of the ruins. Strong and savvy field agents are needed to begin uncovering the secrets hidden within these ruins.

boardgame.name: The Second Confirmation
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:
A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 1-2.

A Pathfinder Society initiate goes missing on their Confirmation mission to become a fully-fledged field agent. With no update on the initiate’s whereabouts, the Society assembles a group of initiates into a rare group Confirmation in order to spearhead a rescue. It’s up to a new generation of heroes to save one of their own, and potentially make a few big discoveries along the way!

boardgame.name: D-Day Dice (Second Edition): Neoprene Campaign Map
boardgame.description:
This is a 23.5 x 32.75 neoprene mat (one-sided) comprised of battle maps from D-Day Dice (Second Edition) and 2 of its expansions, available exclusively through the 2017 Kickstarter campaign. This item combines 9 specific battle maps into one larger map intended for campaign play, for which the rules and scenarios are included in the Overlord Expansion. The mat has the same dimensions as combining the 9 battle maps individually would have, which is possible to do if desired as none of these 9 battle maps are printed on the back of any of the other 8.

The neoprene mat is comprised of 3 battle maps from the Atlantic Wall (Second Edition) Expansion (the entire left column), one from the Overlord Expansion (the bottom right corner), and the remaining 5 from the D-Day Dice (Second Edition) base game. Specifically, the battle maps, in order of top to bottom, left to right, are:

N21 Achtung Panzer! (Atlantik Wall Expansion)
N07 Chateau de Vaumicel
N09 Mare Fontaine Battery
N20 WN-68 (Atlantik Wall Expansion)
N06 Vierville Draw
N08 Mont Fluery Battery
N19 Dog Red
N02 Omaha Beach
N03B Gold Beach (Overlord Expansion)

Note that the only difference between battle map N03 (from the base game) and N03B is that N03 has a second bunker (with defense of 25, machine gun fire, and 5 courage requirement to enter), which is replaced by a crater on N03B.

boardgame.name: Artsy Fartsy
boardgame.description:
This is NOT your parents’ drawing game!

Not much is off limits in this fast-paced game where artistic skills are not required. Team up with friends and family to draw, guess, and steal clues that will have the whole gang laughing out loud!

boardgame.name: Feast and Famine
boardgame.description:
An expansion for Delve: A Solo Game of Digging Too Deep.

F&F adds several new mechanics to the core game:

a new hunger mechanic that requires you to feed your troops or else lose them to starvation
expanded Inn room that allows for recruiting exotic troops
new production rooms that farm food
new processing rooms that turn raw food into enhance other rooms or troops
new units like butchers, farmers, and bread golems
cave goats! mythic beasts that can bolster your units with milk and cheese, but eventually turn on their masters with ancient powers
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: DELVE: A Solo Game of Digging Too Deep

boardgame.name: The Final Light-Year: The Leo Sector
boardgame.description:
January 2022 episode for The Final Light-Year.

This kit adds a new sector map, new overlord, and some additional cards.


Released in the January 2022 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

boardgame.name: Skulls of Sedlec: Valentine Features
boardgame.description:
Two new features on 1 double-sided card to add to your solo games!

Requires Skulls of Sedlec and Monstrance expansion to play.


Released in the January 2022 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

boardgame.name: 0-Level Rules: Compleat Meat
boardgame.description:
"Prepare for the thrill of being average or worse.
Role playing games have a proud history of “hopeless characters,” dating back to the early days of Dungeons & Dragons. While most role players prefer acting the part of heroic characters, some relate better to average lunks, who, if suddenly thrust into a dangerous battle, would almost assuredly die a horrible death.

Compleat Meat outlines 10 different options for creating 0-level characters, inspired by the unforgiving character-creation processes of yore, challenging the notion that fantasy heroes must be proficient in anything but pushing a broom. Prepare for the thrill of being average or worse, where the odds of survival are sharply stacked against you. Inside you'll find:

A 1d100 table of substandard zero-level jobs and starter classes.
10 rules variants for creating mediocre characters.
A critical miss table."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: William Shakespeare the Parlor Game
boardgame.description:
A game using Cards Against Humanity mechanics.

A laugh-out-loud mash-up party game for everyone, whether you love Shakespeare’s works, or loathe them. Dealt from a deck of 400 answer cards, complete modern musings such as, “Just tell the judge to ….” with phrases pulled directly from the Bard himself. Your sense of humor paired with Shakespeare’s quick wit will prove (with refreshing hilarity) just how winsome his words remain in the twenty-first century. For fans of William Shakespeare and classic literature, and for fans of anything but.

boardgame.name: Caper: Playmat
boardgame.description: Elevate your heights with this double sided playmat. One side designed for Caper: Europe and the other side designed to enjoy other games on the neoprene surface.

boardgame.name: Earthborne Rangers: il Lascito degli Antichi
Earthborne Rangers: Legacy of the Ancestors
boardgame.description:
A campaign expansion, includes a full playset over 250 new Ranger and Valley cards and 1 campaign guide.

Legacy of the Ancestors features a new story arc that utilizes both the cards and map from the core set as well as the new cards and new maps from the campaign expansion. In it, you’ll journey beyond, above, and below the Valley to explore strange new places and forge new paths.

boardgame.name: Dragon Dice: Kicker Pack 1 – Monsters & Amazons
boardgame.description: Each Monsters & Amazon kicker box contains a 8 dice which are randomly anything from any of 5 races (Dwarf, Goblin, Coral Elf, Lava Elf, or Amazon). So it's possible it includes 0 Amazon dice even!

boardgame.name: Field of Glory: Empires – Persia 550 – 330 BCE
boardgame.description:
This DLC showcases the lightning-fast ascension of Persia from a humble kingdom to one of the largest empires history has ever known. Initially, as Cyrus the Great, you’ll have to overthrow powerful neighbors, like Media, your former liege, Ancient Babylon and its mighty cities, or Lydia, ruled by Croesus, a man rich beyond dreams.

But that’s not all, as Athens and Sparta are vying for supremacy over the Hellenes world, and soon the Aechemenid Empire and the western nations will be on a collision course. There is little chance of the peace holding between these three.
If you prefer to play as the underdog, a certain modest city in Italy might perhaps be a surprising contender. Or perhaps the young city of Carthage, its new empire still far from assured. Opportunities abound!
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 Charles S. Roberts Best Computer Wargame Expansion Nominee

boardgame.name: Castle Dice
boardgame.description:
User Summary

App version of the board game Castle Dice.

boardgame.name: Total War: Warhammer II – The Warden & The Paunch
boardgame.description:
The Warden & the Paunch is the latest Lords Pack for Total War: WARHAMMER II. Introducing two rival Legendary Lords from the world of Warhammer Fantasy Battles, each with their own factions, objectives, mechanics, units and playstyle, for use in both the Eye of the Vortex and Mortal Empires campaigns, and custom/multiplayer battles.

Eltharion the Grim commands Yvresse (High Elves) while Grom the Paunch leads the Broken Axe Tribe (Greenskins). Neither Yvresse nor the Broken Axe tribe are involved in the Vortex race, but are pitted against one another as eternal nemeses, on a collision course to a final climactic encounter where only one can emerge the victor.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 Charles S. Roberts Best Computer Wargame Expansion Nominee

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000: Gladius – Craftworld Aeldari
boardgame.description:
Eons ago the Old Ones and the Necrons fought The War in Heaven. The Old Ones lost, but their mantle was inherited by one of their creations—the Aeldari, a psychically-powerful race of immense sensitivity. Over the subsequent millenia, they ruled the galaxy, slipping over time deeper and deeper into depravity and arrogance.
Their golden age ended with the birth of Slaanesh, the Chaos God of pleasure. At the moment of her birth, the core of the Aeldari civilization was utterly destroyed, its citizens’ souls and even its pantheon all but consumed by the nascent god. Where the Aeldari homeworlds once were, now there is only the Eye of Terror, a massive rift into the Warp. Only a few Aeldari survived: the hardy Exodites; the degenerate Drukhari and mysterious Harlequins, hiding in the Webway; and the restrained Aeldari, on enormous ships known as Craftworlds. Doomed and declining, the Aeldari seek to avoid their own consumption by Slaanesh at all costs. They find themselves on Gladius Prime, chasing a Farseer’s prediction that this planet is key to the survival of all Aeldari...
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 Charles S. Roberts Best Computer Wargame Expansion Nominee

boardgame.name: Combat Mission Shock Force 2
boardgame.description:
The latest title in the famous Combat Mission franchise of wargames, now on Steam. Shock Force 2 brings you to a hypothetical conflict in Syria between the forces of NATO and the Syrian Army.

Take command of US Stryker Brigade Combat Teams (SBCT) and Heavy Brigade Combat Teams (HBCT) to fight against Syrian Army Infantry, Mechanized and Armored units in an arid setting. Experience the full range of modern threats to conventional military forces, including irregular combat forces, terrorists, spies, suicide bombers, IED's and other deadly tools employed in the asymmetric warfare of the modern day. Play the Task Force Thunder campaign, more than a dozen carefully crafted battles, or unlimited Quick Battles.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 Charles S. Roberts Best Computer Wargame Expansion Nominee

boardgame.name: Winnie-eats-You
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Winnie the Pooh is Public Domain now!

This fun little project was born of my love of Winnie the Pooh (a big part of my childhood) and my love of Mork Borg.

boardgame.name: The Monk
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A monk class for use in Old School Essentials and similar Basic Era roleplaying games.

boardgame.name: I Saw It First!: Jungle
boardgame.description:
Three hundred jungle animals populate the board of this carefully engineered game. Some are familiar, like the leopard or the hippopotamus, others less so, like the eyelash viper or the giraffe weevil. Pull a counter from the bag featuring one of the 300 animals in this game and be the first to spot that animal on the board! Coming in a triangular box with a hexagonal double–sided board, this game features charming illustrations by Caroline Selmes. Simple to understand but addictive to play, this fun and challenging game will delight adults and children alike.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Earn your Crust
boardgame.description:
From Publisher:
A supplement for Warlock!, the old-school roleplaying game inspired by early British tabletop gaming.

Earn your crust is a compendium of careers from across the length and breadth of the Kingdom! Jesters, plague doctors, champions and conjurers, all can be found within these pages...

Includes thirty six new basic careers, five advanced careers and four master careers, as well as new options to speed character creation.

Time to earn your crust!

boardgame.name: Thrilling Adventures!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Powered by the Apocalypse role playing game is for everyone who's ever watched pulp adventure movies and thought, "I want to do that!" Whether you wished you could play the dashing hero clambering up dangerous bluffs; or the plucky kid who miraculously manages to escape from the villains; or the fortune teller who discovers deep and ancient secrets of the occult that No Man Should Know - you can do it all here.

The idea behind Thrilling Adventures! is to re-create the atmosphere of those pulp adventure movies we all love; so the characters, the moves, and the setting are designed to create a sense of danger, excitement, and drama.

boardgame.name: Eccentric Exploits!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Make your adventures even more thrilling with Eccentric Exploits!, the extraordinary expansion to the Thrilling Adventures! role-playing game. In this guide you’ll find all kinds of helpful material to include elements of Steampunk, Weird Science, and Cthulhu Horror into your adventures!

boardgame.name: The Old School Companion: Medieval-Authentic Tome 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a compilation of Medieval-Authentic adventures from RPGPundit Presents. This tome provides countless hours of adventure for RPGPundit's Lion & Dragon RPG, as well as other OSR fantasy games. It features...

17 adventure scenarios
9 Occult Killer Antagonist scenarios

boardgame.name: Speak with Animals: Animal Companions I (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Speak with Animals: Animal Companions I adds 10 new animal companion stat blocks for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game including the dire corgi, giant hamster, fossa and hyaenodon. Additionally, you will get full NPC stat blocks for the new animals introduced as animal companions in this book and animal companions previously published by the author in the Legendary Hunters book published by Legendary Games (The coyote and harpy eagle).

boardgame.name: Dungeon Architect Book of Adventures Volume I
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A generic adventure that can be adapted and used in d20, AD&D(1-5), and Pathfinder.

The Dungeon Architect Book of Adventures Vol. I is a compilation of 4 mini-adventures designed to provide hours of entertainment for adventuring groups. As with all of our products, the game master must add his/her own monsters, treasures, and traps to challenge and reward the characters in whatever gaming system they play. From the fallen halls of a mad alchemist, to the hidden lair of thieves, and beyond the crypt of a long (presumably) dead necromancer, these mini-adventures will provide enjoyment and hopefully inspiration for greater challenges to overcome.

boardgame.name: Crown of Ash
boardgame.description:
Crown of Ash is a strategic worker placement and area control game for 1 to 4 players.

The promise of a dreamless sleep was a lie. The Lords awoke after a hundred years of staring into deepest depths of oblivion; every moment wracked by nightmarish dreams. They no longer cared for peace, but now desired power.

The bleak slumber had revealed an ancient secret to them, the arcane knowledge of necromancy. It gave them the ability to build armies from the wastes of their lands. Those fallen in the first war, would rise again and march into a bloody second, a devastating conflict that would determine who, at last, would lay claim to the Crown of Ash.

Players take on the role of vengeful necromancers. Sending out their loyal minions to do their bidding.

Gathering resources to the raise powerful undead armies

Building mighty structures offering better resources and earning influence over the land

Marching your undead army into battle to take other players structures and defend your own with all your might

Over 4 rounds players will earn influence points based on the structures they control, the player with the most influence at the end of the game will take control of the kingdom and rule for the rest of time.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Vemora (Generic)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A generic adventure that can be adapted and used in d20, AD&D(1-5), and Pathfinder.

The village of Dunnerton has been attacked and the people are in need of help. Only brave adventures can overcome the dangers of a fallen keep and recover a healing relic to save the people. But, monsters and traps might not be the only obstacles the heroes will face. An ancient plague was responsible for the keep's demise and many believe it still festers in the ruin of Thornburg Keep.

boardgame.name: The Babylon Compulsion (Revised)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An implant fails, plunging a former compulsive gambler and womanizer back into a world of darkness and danger. His return to his former haunts sets off a chain of circumstances that lead to revenge, betrayal, and violence in the glitteringly dark heart of America's Sin City.

The Babylon Compulsion is a cyberpunk adventure set in the near future. The plot revolves around the search for a man with a bad-boy past, the vengeful club owner he wronged, and the dangerous women who love him; set among the glitz, gambling and danger of Las Vegas.

The adventure includes a full overview of the plot, suggestions for setting a film noir tone, full NPCs writeups complete with character motivations, several maps helping to detail the action, and suggestions for making Las Vegas even more dangerous than it already is.

This version is compatible with New World: 2D6 Adventure in a Cyberpunk America, which uses the Cepheus Engine (CE), Cepheus Deluxe (CD), and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG) rules.
boardgame.rpgsetting: New World: 2D6 Adventure in a Cyberpunk America

boardgame.name: Unsolved Case 0001: Marta Alfieri
boardgame.description:
Marta Alfieri, 26, was found dead in her apartment on her birthday 3-06-2019. Her roommate and best friend, Leonardo Salo, found her at 9:10 pm. The two lived together with two other roommates in the usually quiet town of Vernò, or at least apparently. Behind the calm lurks the storm, and it will be you who will have to solve the case. The Vernò police station will rely on you and deliver all the materials to you.

Unsolved Case:0001 is an at home mystery game, were you receive a police file with documents, photos, diagrams, etc and have to deduce the killer.

Inside the game you will find the sealed envelope with the solution. However, if you don't want to give up and open the envelope, you will have some help. In the box, you will be provided with a code that you will need to send us in case you want to ask for our help.

Il primo gioco di simulazione investigativa italiano.
Un gioco che non è usuale.
Non sarà il solito gioco in scatola, anche perché qui la scatola non sarà presente!
Immaginate di essere degli investigatori.
Perfetto. Noi vi consegneremo la “busta delle indagini”.
All’intento troverete tutto il materiale che vi servirà per risolvere l’omicidio.
Voi dovrete metterci solamente un po’...di Intuito!

boardgame.name: Hand of Nakresh
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forty-Fingered Nakresh Has a Hand in Every Pocket!

Forty-Fingered Nakresh is the simian demon‑god of wizards and thieves. His eight hands grasp all there is to take and hold tight. It is said he reserves his lowest left hand for the boldest and most daring of his thefts. And his cult—a pentarchical assemblage of the region’s most infamous scoundrels and their followers—revere their god by emulating this behavior. These five crime lords plot the most spectacular thefts in order to appease their deity and outdo the other members of their organization.

The 19-page Hand of Nakresh PDF includes:

Cult leaders, organization, and goals with full stats for the five great rival leaders of the cult
Cult plans and adventure hooks for levels 1 to 12
Specific and generic cultists with stats, including tengu bravos and roachling lieutenants
Magic items such as the Monkey's Paw of Fortune
A cult vehicle that has to be seen to be believed—the clockwork siege crab!


Expand your campaign with thievery and skullduggery, with the Hand of Nakresh!

boardgame.name: Merchant Caravan
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

This instalment is designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life the merchant caravans in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Fabula Rasa: Horror
boardgame.description:
In Fabula Rasa, players take turns telling a constantly changing story as is typical of oral traditions. The motifs on the cards provide visual bullet points for people, objects, and locations that are central to the action, things that must be remembered in the correct order, with cards disappearing and new ones being added each round. Those who, as a narrator, manage to present their version of the story without errors will be rewarded accordingly.

Fabula Rasa: Horror contains 30 cards that feature characters (Dracula, werewolf, zombie), objects (carriage, cape, torch), and locations (castle, village, sinister alley) that can be combined with either of the standalone games Fabula Rasa: Crime or Fabula Rasa: Seemannsgarn.

boardgame.name: An Introduction to Absalom
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This introductory issue of Populated Hexes Monthly provides a background to the world of Absalom: basic setting information and maps that place the Third Kingdom Games products into a geographic context.

boardgame.name: Gondolieri
boardgame.description:
It's not easy to take all the tourists to the sights they want to see in Venice — because everyone wants to admire the same beautiful and impressive monuments.

In Gondolieri, players slip into the role of the gondolieri, who take their passengers to the most sought-after sights. After the first roll of the dice, the player decides with which of their gondolieri they want to advance. Each gondoliere has a different destination that they want to get as close to as possible. You can roll the dice more if you'd like, and as long as you roll the right color, the gondoliere can continue to move forward.

There is only one problem: There is always a traffic jam at the Rialto Bridge — and after that the gondoliere has to continue in one go until they reach their destination because otherwise they will be too late for new guests. Keep an eye on the opposing gondolieri as they can still profit from the remaining dice!

boardgame.name: Batteries Low, Getting Dark
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

While traveling along an old, westbound trail, characters notice a mysterious petrified forest within sight of their latest campsite. Upon investigating, they discover a pre-war manufacturing plant amidst the tall, stone-skinned trees. Lying hidden in the forest, the facility seems to be relatively untouched since the great wars. If the characters can find a way in, they are sure to find vast, untold resources within...

This adventure was designed for use with first edition Gamma World but can be adapted to any post-apocalyptic roleplaying game.

boardgame.name: Into the Wreckage
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

After several uneventful days of westward travel, your group has discovered an unusual protrusion in the relatively flat wasteland. Your field glasses reveal a large metallic object partially covered in years of dirt and sand. Strange markings on its exterior remind you of the stories you've heard about the League of Free Men, a pre-apocalyptic organization known for its unified government views. The group was also known for their vast wealth and technological capabilities. What is this object and why is it in the middle of nowhere? More importantly, has it already been looted or does it still contain valuable ancient technology?

boardgame.name: Evil Mutant Society
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

S.I.D.s is short for Super-powered Individual Database. This is a database that various government agencies are starting to use to keep track of all the various villains and heroes. Over the last few years, the number of super-powered individuals has skyrocketed.

It has become a full-time job to try and keep track of them as well as updated information about them, that is the purpose of this database. The database is designed to give law enforcement as much information as possible on supervillains or superheroes they may need to call for help.

This is a series of small products that will introduce new villains and heroes for your campaign.

This installment will introduce a new organization Evil Mutant Society in a 40 page PDF.
A large group of mutants out to make the world save for mutants. Of course, getting rich and disrupting the anti-mutant movement is just a bonus.

boardgame.name: The Bitter Root of War
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The War of the Paragons begins! This new story arc picks up right where The Coming of the Destroyer 15-part story arc leaves off!

When a plea from an unexpected ally asks the Heroes to protect a lost Ansharan Gate. Can they stand against an invading army and destroy their devastating weapon?

A Standard adventure optimized for five 7th level characters.
boardgame.rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires

boardgame.name: The Bitter Root of War
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This adventure is the ninth installment in the War of the Paragons story arc!

When a plea from an unexpected ally asks the Heroes to protect a lost Ansharan Gate. Can they stand against an invading army and destroy their devastating weapon?

A Standard adventure optimized for five Tier III Heroes.
boardgame.rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires
boardgame.rpgseries: Legends of Arcanis Season 3: War of the Paragons

boardgame.name: The Omega File: Anubis
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Omega Files are series of products detailing people, places, and organizations for use in your Villains and Vigilantes campaign. Each release contains everything you need to easily insert a particular character, a group, organization, or location into your game. Explore the world of the Omega Files in this dynamic entry. This entry contains:

Contains a fully detailed character writeup detailing the villainous Anubis.

A full color character illustration.

An overview of Anubis' cult, the Watchful Eye of Helios.

A full color map of a sample Watchful Eye of Helios temple.

boardgame.name: Goblin Coaster
boardgame.description:
The goblins want to make their dungeon more attractive and have decided to build a really daring roller coaster: the Goblin Coaster. The construction site is just opening when the unbelievable happens. Due to a misunderstanding, one of the goblins has already started the coaster! Will the goblins manage to finish building the roller coaster before the wagon arrives at the end of the track and crashes?

In the fast-paced co-operative tile-laying game Goblin Coaster, players take on the role of the goblins and do what they can to finish the roller coaster quickly! To do so, players must clear tiles with track sections — but the next type of tile is predetermined and players must quickly create the matching track section. It's a funny competition against time, which (hopefully!) will result in a finished roller coaster at the end!

boardgame.name: Fresh Fruits
boardgame.description:
Aunt Helga has sent you shopping with one command at the forefront: Buy the juiciest fruits!

But it won't be easy to bring them home in one piece as the heavy fruits must not be placed on top of the lighter ones — and of course you should buy exactly the fruits that Aunt Helga would like to have. Your challenge in Fresh Fruits is to pack your basket in just the right way with all the required fruits so that nothing is crushed and no juice is spilled. Whoever fulfills the most requirements will score best and win.

boardgame.name: Focus Storia: Il Grande Gioco
boardgame.description: In the board game we will be able to cross different historical periods: from classical antiquity to the Middle Ages, from modern to contemporary history. In a question and answer game, you move across the board

boardgame.name: Overbooking
boardgame.description:
Once upon a time there was a king who wanted to throw a royal party of the finest for his daughter. Thousands of guests from all over the country were invited; traveling merchants, monks, soldiers, and many others flocked to the capital. But, oh no! Because everyone had hoped for last-minute discounts, no one had pre-booked a hotel room. Now the great race for the last free rooms begins! Who will get a place to sleep, who will have to stay outside, and who will make it through the back door with a nasty trick?

In Overbooking, each player tries to place their guest cards in the few available hotels to collect points — but each hotel can accommodate only a certain number of guests. You have to guess how many guests your opponents will send into the race for the rooms and what devious plans they will make to get in your way.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Sparspel
boardgame.description:
Game released by the grocery store chain “Spar”.
Basic roll & move game.

boardgame.name: Dr. Seuss 3 Games in ONE!
boardgame.description:
A collection of three Dr. Seuss games:

The Cat in the Hat Game
Dr. Seuss's ABC Game
One Fish Two Fish Red Fish Blue Fish Card Game
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: The Cat in the Hat Game
One Fish Two Fish Red Fish Go Fish! Card Game

boardgame.name: The Sunken Cemetery
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Two weeks ago, as workers were digging a new section for the sewer, they broke a wall that led them to a big underground cave. The floor of this cave was filled with graves, which made the officials believe they found something of archaeological value, perhaps remnants of the old Cor'Duer or a civilization which lived here before the city even existed.

As the workers were exploring these graves, they awoke something ancient. Skeletal barbarians, shamans and wizards rose from their rest and attacked, killing all but one worker who escaped to tell the tale. What's even worse, some of these monsters have been reported to have made their way to the surface, terrorizing locals before the city watch could intervene.

boardgame.name: Melee Magi
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A little something extra for your PF2 game!

The magnificent magus class is back with Pathfinder Second Edition's Secrets of Magic, and we are here with a ton of terrific options to make your magus a menace in melee! You can take up a trio of new combat studies with Shadow Boxer, Spined Stone, and Uppercut Updraft, accompanied by 10 fantastic feats and focus spells like cracked earth, reaching shadows, Crossbreeze Counter, and Duplicitous Spellstrike!

boardgame.name: The Frightful Dozen
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

More Foes to Amaze and Challenge Your Heroes

This book includes game statistics, background information, tactics and secrets of twelve unusual creatures of Norindaal, with rules for encounters suited for parties of all experience levels. Each monster has an illustration, unique reactions or behavior tables, specific loot, and story hooks to bring them into your games of Four Against Darkness'.

You will meet the Stinkhorn, Madame Peony, the Transparent Couple, Orum the Human Spider, Matryona, the Glass-Toothed Ripper, the Kidnapping Hag, Iglar the Mosquito-fiends, the Rottlor, Nevar of the Rotting Hand, the Krabadarus and the Telltale Birds.

boardgame.name: Mythic Magazine Compilation #1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mythic Magazine is a monthly ezine with tips, rules, and more goodies for the Mythic Role-Playing System, Mythic Game Master Emulator, and Crafter Series from Word Mill Games.

This compilation collects the first six issues, volumes 1-6, into a single book. Articles include:

Removing Ambiguity From Ambiguous Events: A discussion about how to get more out of the Ambiguous Event entry on the Event Focus Table.
Behavior Checks Simplified: A new version of the Behavior Check system from Mythic Variations II that's slimmer and faster.
Making The Most Of Altered Scenes: Tips and suggestions for creating Altered Scenes in Mythic, with the new Scene Adjustment Table for a random twist.
Randomized Location Crafting: A complete reworking of The Location Crafter system providing an option for generating Regions completely randomly without preparing Lists ahead of time.
Using Mythic With Published Adventures: A guide for going solo in published adventures and modules using Mythic.
Randon Dungeon Crawl Generation: A continuation of last month's article on randomizing The Location Crafter, take it a step further and deeper with a randomized system focused on generating a classic dungeon crawl.
Getting Prepared For A Solo Adventure: Tips and suggestions to make your solo sessions fun and efficient. Plus, a collection of forms from Mythic and The Adventure Crafter so you have them all in one convenient location.
Mythic & Crafter Flowcharts: By popular demand, a host of Mythic and Crafter rules mechanics presented in easy to follow flowchart form to make your solo play faster and easier.
Combining Mythic With The Adventure Crafter: Expanding on the rules presented in The Adventure Crafter, this article gives additional tips and rules for making the two systems work together more smoothly.
Generating Dark Woods And Wild Places: A new specialized Region for use with the randomized Location Crafter rules from issue #2, this Region presents Woods: Dark, Ancient, and Horror.
Creating Mystery Adventures: Create genuine mysteries in Mythic with this approach that serves as an overlay to standard Mythic play, guiding your Adventure through a path requiring you to uncover Clues and Suspects to solve a Mystery.
Use Mythic To Learn A New RPG: Tips and suggestions on how to combine Mythic with an RPG you are unfamiliar with, to use Fate Questions to help you learn the game as you play it.

boardgame.name: Palm Laboratory
boardgame.description:
Creating unique monsters, powerful devices, and fantastic potions is a dangerous business. As you gain power and succeed in your experiments you must also maintain your laboratory to prevent catastrophe. Take on the many challenges of Palm Laboratory anywhere you go with this handheld resource management game.

Designed in the style of its predecessor, Palm Island, Palm Laboratory is a SOLO ONLY game that brings familiar mechanics with a new style of play. Like Palm Island, Palm Laboratory uses a small deck of 4 sided cards and deck transforming mechanics to flip and rotate cards. As improve each card each will increase your resource production, gain more points, or help to achieve the goal of your current game.

Each time you play Palm Laboratory you will select a Primary Goal. This defines the rules for victory or defeat. Some goals add additional cards to you to generate new resources or other goal-specific objectives.

Each turn you will review the top two cards of your deck and take an action listed on the top section of either card or discard the top card by placing it in the back of the deck. When you take a card action you do so by paying any required cost and then following the action type rotating 180 degrees flipping it over or storing the card by rotating it 90 degrees so it sticks out. After manipulating the card during an action you then place it in the back of the deck. Cards that are stored will sick out the side which provides resources you can use on future actions.

—description from designer

boardgame.name: Superstition
boardgame.description: "A solo journaling rpg about creating rituals you don't actually believe in, for the sake of your community." Created by Albi as part of Kickstarter's 2021 Zine Quest. One version of the game is available on itch.io, but it is also in booklet form as well as PDF.

boardgame.name: Summit: The Board Game – Sleeves
boardgame.description: A pack of 250+ minimalist premium sleeves – enough to sleeve Summit, Yeti and Teams.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Summit: The Board Game – Yeti expansion

boardgame.name: TANK You Very Much
boardgame.description:
This is a WWII Tank skirmish game. It is primarily a two player (two team) game played on 3d terrain using miniature tanks. Each side controls 1 to 4 WWII era tanks in a fast-paced skirmish game of tank-on-tank warfare. The game is over when one side loses their last tank or when a pre-determined objective has been met.

This is a dice allocation game and each tank starts the game with 5 basic d6 and 1 special leader d6. These dice constitute the command decisions made by each tank and will determine which actions can be taken by that take in a give round as players allocate dice to activation spots.

Tank commanders must be careful for as damage accumulates they can lose command dice temporarily or permanently representing the pressures and confusion of battle. Additionally, tanks will take physical damage disabling specific tank functions.

As a tank commander you must gauge the risk/reward of confrontation. The initiative system creates a fog of war and uncertainty on when your enemy will move and what maneuvers they have in store.

Button up your tank commanders, the enemy is in sight, now the mettle is tested and only the steadfast will emerge once the smoke of battle clears.

—description from the designer

Harness Black Panther's speed, learn the power of manipulation with Scarlet Witch, unleash Captain Marvel's cosmic powers, or strategize with Iron Man's armory. Players protect their hit points while doing damage to opponents as they try to be the last Super Hero standing to win. The Marvel Mayhem card game features comic-inspired custom illustrations, iconic Marvel character phrases, and fun humor. This fun card game is filled with action and suspense, and can be played in about 10 minutes.

This adventure is designed for three to five 3rd –7th level characters and is optimized for five characters with an average party level (APL) of 5.

The final battle may be deadly for characters below 5th level.

boardgame.name: Gnomeregan

Built deep within the mountains of Dun Morogh, the wondrous city of Gnomeregan was a testament to the gnomes' intelligence and industry. But when the capital was invaded by troggs, the gnomish high tinker was betrayed by his advisor Sicco Thermaplugg. As a result, Gnomeregan was irradiated, and most of its inhabitants slain. The surviving gnomes fled, vowing to return someday and retake their home.

The adventurers have been sent to retake the once glorious capital of the city of the gnomes from invaders and traitors.

The realm is filled with lush forest, open fields, and many forts and castles. Valor, heroism, honor, pride, and battle rules this realm. The Lady of The Lake will open the gates to her realm once every forty years to welcome heroes to share their stories, trade the items or participate in various tourneys.

It is the lack of something that move and motivate characters, not the abundance of it

boardgame.name: Universal Decay: Dragonfire
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to the world of DRAGONFIRE, the "Heavy Metal" fantasy expansion for the Universal Decay: Dead Stars Rule Book. A roleplaying sourcebook for hardcore WEIRD characters, usable in anything from typical Tolkien-esque pseudo-Europe games to replicating album covers from your favorite metal bands...no points are awarded for figuring out which way the pre-made campaign setting included in this book went! So make a Gnome with a Spaghetti-Western fetish, a blood-drinking assassin, a Dwarven bardic priest of the Cult of Heavy Metal, or any other bizarre character that you have always wanted to play. That is the "normal" around here!

boardgame.name: Universal Decay: Dead Stars Rule Book
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dead Stars is a science fiction horror role-playing game powered by the alternate d20 Universal Decay rules system. Pick a race - from the ever-familiar humans to the amorphous gorbrasch or sleazy helizara - strap on some personal armor and pick up a sliver rifle or get a cerebral computer implant and grab your toolkit. Or both. Then get together with your friends to face a universe of dangers, wonders, opportunities, and quite possibly a messy death. This book contains everything you will need to play or run a game in Dead Stars as well as rules for using the Universal Decay system in alternate genres, incorporating everything from swords and sorcery to vehicle energy weapons, personal armor, nanotechnology and starships.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Vault Magazine (No. 17)

Dungeon Vault Magazine is all about providing interesting ideas and lore to DMs and storytellers. Within this issue, you will find varied adventure ideas.

These short modules do not stick to a unified template of sections. Instead, they are organically created and follow their own pace. The types of modules you can expect are city/town settings, regional settings, dungeons, outdoor locations, encounter maps, and one-page adventures. The only exception is a three-chapter adventure named The Fabled Vault which we have featured at the end of the magazine.

boardgame.name: US-China Clash: Modern Naval Battle Taiwan Strait
boardgame.description:
US-China Clash: Modern Naval Battle Taiwan Strait is the same system as our magazine No. 74 Japan-China-Korea-Modern Naval Battle Three Kingdoms and describes the clash between the US and Chinese navy in the sea near Taiwan that may occur in 202x. It is a board simulation game.
In this work, the surface ship / submarine unit is one unit per ship, and the character characteristics of each individual ship and each weapon are reproduced.
As a result, various battles in modern naval battles such as ship-to-ship, ship-to-air, ship-to-submarine, air-to-submarine, and air-to-air are reproduced with a simple game system, and you can play three-dimensional modern naval battles.
In addition to the three introduction scenarios that can be played in a short time, one campaign scenario that asks for strategy planning that combines each weapon on a wide range is attached, and you can enjoy various plays.

Scenarios

Introduction scenario 1: Kinmen Island defense operation
Introduction scenario 2: Break through the first island chain!
Introduction Scenario 3 : Ghost of the Great Ship Giantism
Campaign scenario: Crisis approaching the Taiwan Strait!


Contents
198 counters
1 full map
Time scale: 16 hours to 3 days (depending on scenario)
Unit scale: 1 ship /Several aircrafts
Game area: sea near Taiwan and the entire East China Sea

—user summary (translated and adapted from publisher's Japanese description)


Issue game of Game Journal #81.

boardgame.name: The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport – Look Out Below!
boardgame.description:
A new scenario for Battle for Greyport.

The Scenario comes from The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport: Store Event Kits – Season 2

This scenario comes in two flavours of difficulty so both introductory and seasoned players should find a good time.

Look Out Below! (For new players)
- Use the "Torglesnarf Returns" scenario from the game, with the following changes:
- Encounter 1: Each player's monster group starts with a Kite Bomber whose threat counts toward that player's total. Location monsters are set up normally.
- Encounter 2: After setup, each player adds a Gnome Gunner to their hand and a Kite Bomber to their monster group.
- Enounter 3:Use the Dragon's Fist instead of The Blackened Kraken. If the Dragon's Fist is destroyed, Captain Blake becomes active and loses his armor for the rest of the game. After setup, each player adds a Kite Bomber to their monster group.
- Recommended rest healing: 2

Look Out Below! (Advanced players)
- Use the "Torglesnarf Returns" scenario from the game, with the following changes:
- Encounter 1: Each player's monster group starts with a Kite Bomber whose threat counts toward that player's total. Location monsters are set up normally.
- Encounter 2: After setup, each player adds a Gnome Gunner to the top of their deck and a Kite Bomber to their monster group.
- Enounter 3:Use the Viceroy Lapentius and the Dragon's Fist instead of Cpatain Blake and The Blackened Kraken. After setup, each player adds a Kite Bomber to their monster group.
- Recommended rest healing: 1
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport – Pirates!

boardgame.name: LUSITANIA XXI
boardgame.description:
Dreadful news reaches Rome; in the most remote part of Iberia, Lusitania, a people ungoverned and unwilling to be, has defeated the Roman Empire in another battle. Julius Caesar, Roman Emperor, is furious, he’s had enough.
"Alea iacta est" - the die has been cast.

He calls in his three best commanders with a clear message: travel across the Empire recruiting and equipping the most fearless Legionaries and Barbaric Mercenaries. Then march 4 Roman Legions into Lusitania to crush the heroic resistance. Caesar will lead one of the four legions himself and provides abundant funding to ensure success.

In this game, you either place cards from your hand into a row of 9 possible slots in front of you or exchange cards from your hand with others that best fulfill your goals.
The cards placed on the row give victory points and the first player to reach 21 points will be the winner.
